passage:
(1) The ocean is home to many amazing marine animals. These animals come in different sizes and colors. Some are very small, like tiny fish, while others, like whales, are very large. Marine animals live in all parts of the ocean, from the surface to the deepest areas.

(2) Fish are the most common marine animals. They have gills to breathe underwater and fins to help them swim. Some fish live alone, while others swim in large groups called schools. Sharks are a type of fish that many people fear, but most sharks are not dangerous to humans.

(3) Marine mammals are another important group of sea animals. These include whales, dolphins, and seals. Unlike fish, marine mammals breathe air through lungs. They must swim to the surface regularly to breathe. Whales and dolphins are known for being very intelligent animals. They communicate with each other using special sounds.

(4) The ocean floor is home to many interesting creatures too. Crabs and lobsters walk along the bottom using their many legs. Starfish and sea urchins move slowly across rocks and sand. Octopuses are very smart animals that can change their color to hide from predators. All these different animals make the ocean a fascinating place full of life.

questions.question: According to paragraph 1, marine animals:

options.C: come in different sizes and colors

questions.question: Based on paragraph 2, which statement is TRUE about fish?

options.B: Fish use gills to breathe underwater.
options.C: Most sharks are dangerous to humans.

questions.question: According to the passage, which animals are known for being very intelligent?
The word 'gills' in paragraph 2 most likely refers to:

options.B: body parts that help fish breathe

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what is TRUE about marine mammals?

options.B: They never need to come to the surface.
options.C: They must swim to the surface to breathe.
options.D: They cannot communicate with each other.

questions.question: A 'school' as mentioned in paragraph 2 is:

options.C: a place deep in the ocean
options.D: a large group of fish swimming together

questions.question: Which animals can change their color according to the passage?
According to paragraph 4, what do crabs and lobsters have in common?

options.B: They walk along the ocean floor using many legs.

questions.question: The main purpose of this passage is to:

options.A: explain why the ocean is important
options.B: describe different marine animals and their characteristics
options.C: argue that we should protect marine animals
options.D: compare land animals with sea animals

questions.question: What can be inferred from the passage about the ocean?

options.A: It is too dangerous for humans to explore.
options.B: It has very few different types of animals.
options.C: It is home to a diverse range of animal life.
